boardgame.name: Combat Commander: Pacific
戰鬥指揮官：太平洋篇
boardgame.description: Combat Commander:Pacific is a card-driven board game covering tactical infantry combat in the Pacific Theater of World War II. CC:P's main theme is the addition of three new factions to the Combat Commander family:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Imperial Japan_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; the Pacific US - with a strong emphasis on the US Marine Corps_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; the Pacific Commonwealth - focusing on Indian and ANZAC forces_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;CC:P is a stand alone game in the card-driven Combat Commander game series. While utilizing Combat Commander: Europe's basic rules, CC:P includes numerous rule tweaks and additions in order to more accurately portray tactical warfare as experienced by the participants in and around the Pacific and Indian Oceans. This slightly ramps up the complexity of the Combat Commander series while at the same time imparting a bit more depth and realism. Just a few of the additions include:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Banzai attacks;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;BARs and Thompson SMGs;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Beach landings _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; river crossings;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Hidden movement;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Caves;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Scouts;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Aircraft;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Bayonets;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Mortar spotting;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Treetop snipers;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Reconnoitering._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;SCALE: Each hex of a Combat Commander map is roughly 100 feet across (about 30 meters). Each complete Player Turn abstractly represents several seconds of real time. Each complete Game Turn abstractly represents several minutes of real time._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;UNITS: Due in part to the unique composition of late-war USMC squads and the imbedding of specialized weapon teams within IJA squads, the units in the game are represented by 4-6 man Teams and 8-13 man Squads. Radios _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash; and individual weapons larger than a rifle _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash; are represented by their own counters. Individual Aircraft are also represented with their own counters._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;VICTORY: Players attempt to achieve victory by moving their combat units across the game map to attack their opponent_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s combat units and occupy as many objectives as possible. The degree to which a player succeeds or fails is measured by a scenario_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s specific Objective chits, the destruction of enemy units, and the exiting of friendly units off the opponent_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s board edge._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;GAME FLOW: A game of Combat Commander is divided into several Time segments. There is no sequence of play to follow, however: each Time segment is divided into a variable number of Player Turns, each of which may consist of one or more Fate Card _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Orders_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; conducted by the active player. Fate Card _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Actions_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; may generally be conducted by either player at any time. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Events_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; and die roll _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Triggers_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash; both good and bad _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash; will occur at random intervals to add a bit of chaos and uncertainty to each player_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s perfect plan._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;CC:P includes twelve maps featuring terrain specific to the PTO._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;CC:P's playbook includes:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; twelve scenarios._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Pacific version of the Random Scenario Generator utilizing the new maps and nationalities. This random scenario system provides an almost unending variety of map configurations, force structures, and combat situations._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; section detailing the differences between CC:P and Combat Commander's first two volumes in order that players familiar with those earlier games can jump right into their first scenario with minimal rules reading._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; examples of play._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Design _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Development notes as well as numerous play hints._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Components:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 352x large counters (5/8_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;) _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 280x small counters (1/2_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;) _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 220x 2.5 x 3.5 cards _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 6x 2-sided 17 x 22 maps (twelve maps in total)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 3x 2-sided 8.5 x 11 nation-specific player aid sheets _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 2x 1-sided 8.5 x 11 generic player aid sheets _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 1x 32-page Rulebook_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 1x 32-page Playbook_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 1x Track Display_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;NOTE: Combat Commander:Pacific is a stand-alone game. You do NOT need to own any other Combat Commander game in order to play it, though familiarity with the system would be a plus._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

COMBAT COMMANDER Personalized Heros Do you want to be a Hero? Well who doesn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t want to be a Hero. Now YOU can be a Hero! Think of the look on your opponents face when YOU become the Hero that leads you side to Victory. 9 Personalized Hero Counters one for each country in the COMBAT COMMANER game series. American, Russian, German, (EUROPE) British, French, Italian, (MEDITERRANEAN) Commonwealth, Japan and U.S. Marines! (PACIFIC) Just send your name (or the names you would like to use and yout Personalized Heroes wil be on thier way to you. INCLUDES: Complete mounted and die cut counters! Please allow up to 2 weeks for delivery

GMT Games (GMT0811) Combat Commander:Pacific is a card-driven board game covering tactical infantry combat in the Pacific Theater of World War II. CC:Pacific_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s main theme is the addition of three new factions to the Combat Commander family: Imperial Japan, and the Pacific US - with a strong emphasis on the US Marine Corps, and the Pacific Commonwealth - focusing on Indian and ANZAC forces. CC:Pacific is a stand alone game in the card-driven Combat Commander game series. While utilizing Combat Commander: Europe_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s basic rules, CC:Pacific includes numerous rule tweaks and additions in order to more accurately portray tactical warfare as experienced by the participants in and around the Pacific and Indian Oceans. This will slightly ramp up the complexity of the Combat Commander series while at the same time imparting a bit more depth and realism. Just a few of the additions include: Banzai attacks, BARs and Thompson SMGs, Beach landings _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; river crossings, Hidden movement, Caves, Scouts, Aircraft, Bayonets, Mortar spotting, Reconnoitering.

Game is in excellent condition. Counters punched and tastefully trimmed. Includes: - _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;like new_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; (never been played) condition Battle Pack Nr 4 – New Guinea. - 2 GMT counter trays.

Like new, fate cards sleeved, 3 gmt trays, 2 gmt printed rulebooks (good for both players!) started to counter clip and then got lazy. all counters/cards/maps accounted for. shipping is $12 conus usps med box. Will hear other offers/trades if you wish... current interests operation barbarossa, Red winter among other games.

Combat Commander:Pacific is a card-driven board game covering tactical infantry combat in the Pacific Theater of World War II. CC:Pacific_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s main theme is the addition of three new factions to the Combat Commander family: Imperial Japan, and the Pacific US - with a strong emphasis on the US Marine Corps, and the Pacific Commonwealth - focusing on Indian and ANZAC forces. CC:Pacific is a stand alone game in the card-driven Combat Commander game series. While utilizing Combat Commander: Europe_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s basic rules, CC:Pacific includes numerous rule tweaks and additions in order to more accurately portray tactical warfare as experienced by the participants in and around the Pacific and Indian Oceans. This will slightly ramp up the complexity of the Combat Commander series while at the same time imparting a bit more depth and realism. Just a few of the additions include: Banzai attacks, BARs and Thompson SMGs, Beach landings _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; river crossings, Hidden movement, Caves, Scouts, Aircraft, Bayonets, Mortar spotting, Reconnoitering.

GMT Games (GMT0811) Combat Commander: Pacific is a card-driven board game covering tactical infantry combat in the Pacific Theater of World War II. CC: Pacific_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s main theme is the addition of three new factions to the Combat Commander family: Imperial Japan, and the Pacific US - with a strong emphasis on the US Marine Corps, and the Pacific Commonwealth - focusing on Indian and ANZAC forces. CC: Pacific is a stand alone game in the card-driven Combat Commander game series. While utilizing Combat Commander: Europe_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s basic rules, CC: Pacific includes numerous rule tweaks and additions in order to more accurately portray tactical warfare as experienced by the participants in and around the Pacific and Indian Oceans. This will slightly ramp up the complexity of the Combat Commander series while at the same time imparting a bit more depth and realism. Just a few of the additions include: Banzai attacks, BARs and Thompson SMGs, Beach landings _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; river crossings, Hidden movement, Caves, Scouts, Aircraft, Bayonets, Mortar spotting, Reconnoitering.
